factoid: Prince Anatole dined that day with Dólokhov.
Prince Anatole consulted Dólokhov as to how to remedy the unfortunate affair.
Pierre was looking for Prince Anatole.
It seemed essential for Prince Anatole to see Natásha.
Prince Anatole drove to his sister’s house in the evening to discuss arranging a meeting.
Pierre returned home after searching all over Moscow.
Pierre’s valet informed Pierre that Prince Anatole was with Countess Rostóva.
Countess Rostóva’s drawing room was full of guests.
Pierre entered the drawing room without greeting Hélène, Pierre’s wife.
Pierre had not seen Hélène since his return.
At that moment Hélène was more repulsive to Pierre than ever.
Pierre saw Prince Anatole and went up to him.
Countess Rostóva said, "Ah, Pierre."
Countess Rostóva said, "You don’t know what a plight our Prince Anatole…"

Countess Rostóva stopped, observing Pierre’s forward thrust of his head, glowing eyes, and resolute gait, indicating rage and strength, which she knew and had experienced after Pierre’s duel with Dólokhov.
Pierre told Hélène, "Where you are, there is vice and evil!"
Pierre told Prince Anatole in French, "Anatole, come with me! I must speak to you."
Prince Anatole glanced at his sister, rose submissively, and was ready to follow Pierre.
Pierre took Prince Anatole by the arm, pulled him toward himself, and led him out of the room.
Hélène whispered to Pierre, "If you allow yourself in my drawing room…"
Pierre did not reply to Hélène and went out of the room.
Prince Anatole followed Pierre with a jaunty step, but his face betrayed anxiety.
Pierre entered his study, closed the door, and addressed Prince Anatole without looking at him.
Pierre asked Prince Anatole, "You promised Countess Rostóva to marry her and were about to elope with her, is that so?"
Prince Anatole answered in French, "Mon cher, I don’t consider myself bound to answer questions put to me in that tone."
Pierre’s face, already pale, became distorted by fury.
Pierre seized Prince Anatole by the collar of his uniform with his big hand and shook him from side to side until Prince Anatole’s face showed terror.
Pierre repeated, "When I tell you that I must talk to you…"
Prince Anatole said, "Come now, this is stupid. What?" and fingered a button of his collar that had been wrenched loose.

Pierre said, "You’re a scoundrel and a blackguard, and I don’t know what deprives me from the pleasure of smashing your head with this!" Pierre expressed himself artificially because he was speaking French.
Pierre took a heavy paperweight, lifted it threateningly, then put it back in its place.
Pierre asked, "Did you promise to marry her?"
Prince Anatole replied, "I didn’t think of it. I never promised."
Pierre interrupted Prince Anatole.
Pierre asked, "Have you any letters of hers? Any letters?" while moving toward Prince Anatole.
Prince Anatole glanced at Pierre, thrust his hand into his pocket, and drew out his pocketbook.
Pierre took the letter Prince Anatole handed him, pushed aside a table that stood in his way, and threw himself on the sofa.
Pierre said, "I shan’t be violent, don’t be afraid!" in response to Prince Anatole’s frightened gesture.
Pierre said, "First, the letters."
Pierre said, "Secondly, tomorrow you must get out of Moscow."

Pierre said, "Thirdly, you must never speak of what has passed between you and Countess Rostóva. I know I can’t prevent you from doing so, but if you have a spark of conscience…" Pierre paced the room several times in silence.
Prince Anatole sat at a table frowning and biting his lips.

Prince Anatole said, "After all, you must understand that besides your pleasure there is such a thing as other people’s happiness and peace, and that you are ruining a whole life for the sake of amusing yourself!"
Prince Anatole said, "Amuse yourself with women like my wife— for they know what you want of them."
Prince Anatole said, "They are armed against you by the same experience of debauchery."
Prince Anatole said, "But to promise a maid to marry her, to deceive, to kidnap… Don’t you understand that it is as mean as beating an old man or a child?"
